content: Hi
if I wish to discuss algebraic geometry argument can I post it here? Is there latex rendering here?
I am new to Zulip.
Yes, just enter the title of your question in the box above while you are writing your comment. (Or one of us can do it later.)
@John Baez Thanks!

Question:

The setting is as follows let us say that X=C1×C2×C3×C4X = C_1 \times C_2 \times C_3 \times C_4X=C1​×C2​×C3​×C4​ and DDD is a surface in XXX. Assume I have a rational function on DDD and KKK being a curve in XXX that is one of the components of the divisors of f. That is if div(f)D=∑niKidiv(f)_D = \sum n_iK_idiv(f)D​=∑ni​Ki​ then K:=KiK := K_iK:=Ki​.

Consider the following surfaces Z=Pr1,2,3(K)×C4Z = Pr_{1,2,3}(K) \times C_4Z=Pr1,2,3​(K)×C4​ and Z′=C1×Pr2,3,4(K)Z' = C_1 \times Pr_{2,3,4}(K)Z′=C1​×Pr2,3,4​(K). KKK is subset of both of them.

I wish to construct curves W1,…,WmW_1,\ldots,W_mW1​,…,Wm​ on surfaces $$Z$ and $Z'$$ in either one of surfaces or both where Wi∼homWi+1W{i} \sim_{hom} W{i + 1}Wi∼hom​Wi+1 such that mK−(W1−W2)+…(Wm−1−Wm)mK - (W_1 - W_2) + \ldots (W_{m - 1} - W_m)mK−(W1​−W2​)+…(Wm−1​−Wm​) is either zero or homologically equivalent to curves of the form p×Vp \times Vp×V for VVV a curve and p a point, where WiW_iWi​ could also be KKK.

For instance suppose that W1−K hom∑pi×VW_1 - K ~_{hom} \sum p_i \times VW1​−K hom​∑pi​×V on ZZZ and W2−W1 homsumpi×VW_2 - W_1 ~_{hom} sum p_i \times VW2​−W1​ hom​sumpi​×V on Z′Z'Z′ such that W2+K∼hompi×VW_2 + K \sim_{hom} p_i \times VW2​+K∼hom​pi​×V it follows 2K+(W1−K)+(W2−W1)=K+W2∼hom∑pi×V2K + (W_1 - K) + (W_2 - W_1) = K + W_2 \sim_{hom} \sum p_i \times V2K+(W1​−K)+(W2​−W1​)=K+W2​∼hom​∑pi​×V.
You need to use double dollar signs, like S$, to get LaTeX to work here.
oh okay thanks for letting me know I will update the above
You can edit your question replacing each $ with SS.

[K]=(a1,b1,v1)[K] = (a_1,b_1,v_1)[K]=(a1​,b1​,v1​) in cohomology. If v1=0v_1 = 0v1​=0 then we are done because then KKK would be homologically equivalent to curves of the form Pr1,2,3(K)×p+q×C4Pr_{1,2,3}(K) \times p + q \times C_4Pr1,2,3​(K)×p+q×C4​ so for instance K−(K−Pr1,2,3(K)×p+q×C4)=Pr1,2,3(K)×p+q×C4K - (K - Pr_{1,2,3}(K) \times p + q \times C_4) = Pr_{1,2,3}(K) \times p + q \times C_4K−(K−Pr1,2,3​(K)×p+q×C4​)=Pr1,2,3​(K)×p+q×C4​

Pick an element $a$ in the first element of kunneth decomposition that is in the Hdg2(Pr1,2,3(K)×C4)Hdg^2(Pr_{1,2,3}(K) \times C_4)Hdg2(Pr1,2,3​(K)×C4​). It follows that the element (a,0,−v)(a,0,-v)(a,0,−v) is in Hdg2(Pr1,2,3(K)×C4)Hdg^2(Pr_{1,2,3}(K) \times C_4)Hdg2(Pr1,2,3​(K)×C4​). By Lefschetz (1,1) theorem we have that there exists a curve W1W_1W1​ such that [W1]=(a,0,−v)[W_1] = (a,0,-v)[W1​]=(a,0,−v). It follows that K+W1=(a1,b1,v)+(a,0,−v)=(a1+a,b1,0)K + W_1 = (a_1,b_1,v) + (a,0,-v) = (a_1 + a,b_1,0)K+W1​=(a1​,b1​,v)+(a,0,−v)=(a1​+a,b1​,0) so it follows that
K+W1∼hom∑pi×VK + W_1 \sim_{hom} \sum p_i \times VK+W1​∼hom​∑pi​×V on $Z_1$$

doing the same idea for Z′=C1×Pr2,3,4(K)Z^{\prime} = C_1 \times Pr_{2,3,4}(K)Z′=C1​×Pr2,3,4​(K) we get that we can construct curve W2W_2W2​ such that W2+K∼hom∑pi×VW_2 + K \sim_{hom} \sum p_i \times VW2​+K∼hom​∑pi​×V.

Notice W2⊂C1×Pr2,3,4(K)⊂C1×Pr2,3(K)×C4W_2 \subset C_1 \times Pr_{2,3,4}(K) \subset C_1 \times Pr_{2,3}(K) \times C_4W2​⊂C1​×Pr2,3,4​(K)⊂C1​×Pr2,3​(K)×C4​ and similarly for W1W_1W1​.

From the relation K+W1∼hom∑pi×VK + W_1 \sim_{hom} \sum p_i \times VK+W1​∼hom​∑pi​×V and K+W2∼hompi×VK + W_2 \sim_{hom} p_i \times VK+W2​∼hom​pi​×V it follows that −W1−W2∼homHVC-W_1 - W_2 \sim_{hom} HVC−W1​−W2​∼hom​HVC in C1×Pr2,3(K)×C4C_1 \times Pr_{2,3}(K) \times C_4C1​×Pr2,3​(K)×C4​. Can we construct a surface subset of C1×Pr2,3(K)×C4C_1 \times Pr_{2,3}(K) \times C_4C1​×Pr2,3​(K)×C4​ where the relation −(W1+W2)∼hom∑pi×V-(W_1 + W_2) \sim_{hom} \sum p_i \times V−(W1​+W2​)∼hom​∑pi​×V holds?
I think that we can simple take the union C1×Pr2,3,4(K)∪Pr1,2,3(K)×C4C_1 \times Pr_{2,3,4}(K) \cup Pr_{1,2,3}(K) \times C_4C1​×Pr2,3,4​(K)∪Pr1,2,3​(K)×C4​ and the relation above should hold?

Essentially to cut the story short: Suppose we have a curve KKK in C1×C2×C3×C4C_1 \times C_2 \times C_3 \times C_4C1​×C2​×C3​×C4​. Consider the following two surfaces Z1=Pr1,2,3(K)×C4Z_1 = Pr_{1,2,3}(K) \times C_4Z1​=Pr1,2,3​(K)×C4​ and Z2=C1×Pr2,3,4(K)Z_2 = C_1 \times Pr_{2,3,4}(K)Z2​=C1​×Pr2,3,4​(K) can we construct curves Wi,1W_{i,1}Wi,1​ and Wi,2W_{i,2}Wi,2​ in ZjZ_jZj​ where Wi+1,j−Wi−1,j∼hom∑pi×ViW_{i + 1,j} - W{i - 1,j} \sim{hom} \sum p_i \times V_iWi+1,j​−Wi−1,j∼hom∑pi​×Vi​ in ZjZ_jZj​ such that mK+(Wi+1,j−Wi−1,j−∑pi×Vi)+…∼hom∑si×VimK + (W_{i + 1,j} - W_{i - 1,j} - \sum p_i \times Vi) + \ldots \sim_{hom} \sum s_i \times V_imK+(Wi+1,j​−Wi−1,j​−∑pi​×Vi)+…∼hom​∑si​×Vi​ on either Z1Z_1Z1​ or Z2Z_2Z2​ or union of both or other surfaces of that type. I claim my argument above should do that, though I would love to discuss it with people !
I am off to bed I am sorry for late reply I will definitely discuss tomorrow with any reply :)
Good night everyone!
morning

Personally this question is too technical for me... but there may be someone around who can handle it. Since this is a category theory forum, you'll probably get more responses if you ask questions that visibly involve category theory.
@John Baez Sorry for late reply I was eating food. Awesome I will be more active in category theory :). Thanks
(I'm also not that well-versed in AG, but let me suggest to cross-post on mathoverflow.net)
@Matteo Capucci (he/him) Thank you. I will try to do that.
